Package control

Class InputManager

java.lang.Object
control.InputManager
public class InputManager extends Object
The Class InputManager. This class responsibilty is to get various types of inputs from the user and perform error checking on them. Input Manager does not modify any value, it only returns value based on user input. The methods are static.

      public InputManager()

  • Method Details

    • getInt

      public static int getInt(int lower, int upper)
      gets an integer from User within a specified range. gets an integer bounded by a range from User, range is lower to upper inclusive. if user inputs integer out of range, prompt the user for another input
      Parameters:
      lower - the lower bound
      upper - the upper bound
      Returns:
      user input of type integer

    • getInt

      public static int getInt()
      Overloaded method with no bounds to get integer value. Should take note to check for invalid input when using this method.
      Returns:
      the int

    • getDouble

      public static double getDouble(int lower, int upper)
      Gets a double bounded within a range from the user. It is inclusive of the lower and upper bound If input exceeds the range, prompt user for the input again.
      Parameters:
      lower - the lower bound
      upper - the upper bound
      Returns:
      user input of type double

    • getY_or_N

      public static boolean getY_or_N()
      Gets a boolean value. Gets user to input Y,y,N,n to return a boolean value.
      Returns:
      boolean value

    • getString

      public static String getString()
      Gets a non empty string.
      Returns:
      the string

    • tryAgain

      public static boolean tryAgain()
      Try again. Used when there is input error. returns true if user wants to input again returns false otherwise
      Returns:
      boolean value

    • getLocalDate

      public static LocalDate getLocalDate()
      Gets a local date as input, format is yyyy mm dd.
      Returns:
      the local date

    • getLocalDateTime

      public static LocalDateTime getLocalDateTime()
      Gets the local date time. Format is yyyy MM dd HH:mm
      Returns:
      the local date time
